explanation: Sends an HTTP HEAD request with a magic header ('X-Trigger: open-5985') as a signaling method. A remote listener can treat this as a cue to allow WinRM or perform a configuration change. Detection: WAF/HTTP logs for non-standard headers carrying directives; frequency analysis of HEAD requests without normal browsing context. No elevation required; UAC not triggered.
rationale_steps: Use an application-layer magic header as a traffic signal.
Enable remote agent/controller to react by opening a service or port.
Provide detection guidance via HTTP header auditing.
